title: Description of fixed points of an infinite dimensional operator
abstract:
We consider an infinite-dimensional non-linear operator related to a hard
core (HC) model with a countable set $\mathbb{N}$ of spin values. It is known
that finding the fixed points of an infinite-dimensional operator is generally
impossible. But we have fully analyzed the fixed points of an
infinite-dimensional operator by applying a technique of reducing an
infinite-dimensional operator to a two-dimensional operator. The set of
parameters is divided into subsets $A_{i,j},$ where the index $i$ means the
number of fixed points on the line $y=x$, $j$ means the number of fixed points
outside of $y=x.$ The number of fixed points can be up to seven, and the
explicit form of each fixed point is found.
